results.title: Central Asia: crossroads of culture
results.creator_credit: M Raioumov and Tashkent Film Studios
results.brief_description: In the heart of Asia can be seen traces of a great civilization. The Central Asian region formed part of the Kisham Empire, comparable in greatness with that of the Romans. This film shows the relatively unknown cultural heritage of Central Asia. Made in co-operation with UNESCO and with the assistance of the National Commissions for UNESCO of Afghanistan, India, Iran, Pakistan and the USSR.

results.title: Celtic gold in Ireland
results.creator_credit: John Fitzmaurice Mills, Rex Roberts and National Museum of Ireland
results.brief_description: Shows some fine examples of prehistoric Celtic gold work, jewellery and other ornamental pieces, housed in the National Museum. The film also shows some of the places of historical interest where they were found in rural Ireland.

results.title: Cells and what they do
results.brief_description: The story of every living thing begins with the story of the living cell. Through a microscope, children see the parts of a plant cell, parts of an animal cell, the activity inside living cells, the process of cell division, and development of a fertilised egg. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Catching stripies: tuna fishing
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Fisheries and Wildlife
results.brief_description: Shows experimental trials using new equipment and fishing techniques for catching striped tuna near Lakes Entrance in Victoria. Alos shows aspects of the work carried out on the fishing boat.

results.title: Catching stars of baseball
results.brief_description: An instructional film by four of America’s leading catchers in the major baseball leagues. Aimed at junoir baseballers where very few want to take a catcher’s job. Covers areas such as equipment required, stance, signals, throwing, catching, tactics and tagging.

results.title: Carrot nose
results.brief_description: Animated puppets are used to tell a story about some children who visit their grandmother at the farm where they build a snow man whose carrot nose is stolen by rabbits who need food in the wintertime.

results.title: Careers in electronic engineering
results.brief_description: A vocational guide to radio, television and electronics. Opens with a discussion on the relative merits of training programs offered by American trade schools, technical institutes, and universities. Explains how the training in electronic theory and practice gained at a technical institute is specially suited for students planning a career in radio, television or electronic engineering. The film shows various aspects of training at the Valparaiso TEchnical Insitute and shows the opportunities which exist for graduates in television, radio, police radio, aviation, marine radio, and electronic engineering.

results.title: Career education: I want to work for your company
results.brief_description: Dispels the dilemma and frustration of the first job interview by presenting tips for approaching the first interview. Portrays the interaction between interviewer and applicant. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Care and use of hand tools. Pt. III: chisels
results.creator_credit: Plomb Tool Co and Signal Corps Production
results.brief_description: The film describes the uses and types of chisels. General care and handling positions are carefully illustrated, cutting edges are demonstrated and bevelling is explained. A training film.
